definition: woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
to violate a prohibition or ban/prohibited/illicit
to prohibit the use of sth/to ban/(computing) to disable
to prohibit the use of sth/to ban/(computing) to disable

sentences.english: She doubted if she could bear it.
sentences.chinese: 她懷疑自己能否禁受得了。

sentences.english: Will the clean-cut appearance of these students become mere historical remembrances after the lifting of hairstyle regulations?
sentences.chinese: 學生所留的平頭，在髮禁開放後會不會變成歷史鏡頭？

sentences.english: So, in lieu of books, the new trend seems to be banning fat.
sentences.chinese: 於是，繼禁書之後，新的趨勢似乎是要禁脂肪。

sentences.english: The jailer had fallen asleep while a couple of prisoners were singing hymns.
sentences.chinese: 在禁卒睡著的時候，有兩個囚犯在唱聖詩。

sentences.english: EXFORGE is contraindicated in patients who are hypersensitive to amlodipine or valsartan.
sentences.chinese: Exforge禁用於對纈沙坦或氨氯地平敏感患者。

sentences.english: Since film and TV could be prohibited why not novels?
sentences.chinese: 電影電視都能禁，爲什麼不能禁小說？

sentences.english: It's time to abandon the old, bad social traditions and prohibit the firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 該是移風易俗，禁放鞭炮的時候了。

sentences.english: He marked all the foods which were forbidden with a red pencil.
sentences.chinese: 他用紅筆標出所有禁喫的食物。

sentences.english: Thirdly, the future development of the OPCW represents an important topic of this Organization.
sentences.chinese: 第三，禁化武組織未來發展是本組織的一項重要議題。

sentences.english: Have you eaten from the tree which I forbade you?
sentences.chinese: 你定是吃了我禁喫的樹桌子了？

sentences.english: There are no waiver and estoppel rule in China's Insurance Law.
sentences.chinese: 我國保險法中沒有規定棄權和禁反言規則。

sentences.english: Pregnant women should avoid certain foods such as raw eggs.
sentences.chinese: 孕婦應禁喫某些食物，如生雞蛋。

sentences.english: Firstly, the OPCW should make continuous and relentless efforts to press CW destruction forward.
sentences.chinese: 第一，禁化武組織應繼續堅持不懈推進化武銷燬工作。

sentences.english: The Monopolizing-Tea Law is one kind of the Monopolizing Laws, which originated in Tang Dynasty and flourished in Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 榷茶法是禁榷法的一種，起源於唐，興於宋。

sentences.english: Second, banning fireworks is helpful for people's health.
sentences.chinese: 其次，禁放煙火有助於人們的身體健康。

definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
